articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Cambodian King
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Cambodian King
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Samdech Norodom Sihamoni, king of Cambodia, on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of its independence.
					 The Korean people are pleased that the Cambodian people have made big successes in the work to defend the sovereignty and achieve prosperity of the country under the leadership of the king, the message noted.
					
					 Wishing him good health and happiness, it expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Cambodia would steadily develop on good terms.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Cambodian PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Cambodian PM
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Premier Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea and vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Hun Sen, prime minister of Cambodia, on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of its independence. 
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the common interests of their governments and peoples and wished the prime minister greater success in his work for prosperity of the country.
					
					 On the same day, Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho sent a similar message to his Cambodian counterpart Prak Sokhon.

articles.title: Kim Su Kil Meets Delegations of Various Political Parties
articles.content:
Kim Su Kil Meets Delegations of Various Political Parties
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Su Gil, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and chairman of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK who is leading the WPK delegation to the 19th International Meeting of Communist and Workers' Parties and events for marking the 100th anniversary of the October Socialist Revolution held in Russia, had talks with delegations of the South African Communist Party, the Communist Party of India (Marxist) and the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party.
					 Blade Nzimande, general secretary of the C.C., South African Communist Party who is leading its delegation, expressed his party's firm stand to further develop the relations with the WPK, saying that they attach great importance to the bilateral relations of friendship.
					
					 Sitaram Yechury, general secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of India (Marxist) who is leading its delegation, said that they were deeply impressed to witness the signal successes made by the WPK and the Korean people in the building of a powerful socialist nation.
					
					 Hilal Hilal, deputy regional secretary of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party who is leading its delegation, affirmed that the friendly relations between Syria and the DPRK, provided by their preceding leaders and being developed under the deep care of President Bashar Al-Assad and Respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, would remain unchanged though one generation is replaced with another and situation gets more complicated.
					
					 They expressed firm support and solidarity with the just struggle of the WPK and the Korean people who are dynamically pushing forward the building of a powerful socialist nation while braving the U.S. heinous military threat, sanctions and pressure.

articles.title: Meeting of UAWK Active Lecturers
articles.content:
Meeting of UAWK Active Lecturers
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A meeting of active lecturers of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea was held on Wednesday.
					 Present there were officials concerned, officials of the union and exemplary lecturers of the union.
					
					 Kim Chang Yop, chairman of the C.C., UAWK, made a report at the meeting to be followed by speeches.
					
					 They said that in his work "On Further Strengthening the Work of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea" leader Kim Jong Il clearly indicated the task and ways for enhancing the responsibility and role of the union lecturers.
					
					 Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un said that ideological education should be done as required by the preparedness of the agricultural workers and specific conditions of rural areas and made sure that hot wind of agitprop work should be made at construction sites seething with the struggle to implement the decision of the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea, they noted.
					
					 They recalled that all the lecturers have contributed to prepare the agricultural workers to be genuine revolutionaries in rural areas devotedly defending the Party Central Committee with absolute trust in the Supreme Leader and unshakable revolutionary faith.
					
					 They also recalled that the lecturers have positively contributed to the agricultural production by inspiring the agricultural workers to the campaign for implementing the Theses on the Socialist Rural Questions and the Party's policy on agricultural revolution.
					
					 They underlined the need for all lecturers to equip themselves with great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, cherish the spirit of the 2nd Plenary Meeting of the 7th Central Committee of the WPK and thus fully discharge their honorable mission and duty as agitators and educators of the Party policy in the drive for increasing the agricultural production.

articles.title: DPRK Players Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Players Back Home
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- DPRK players came back home Wednesday after taking part in the 2017 Grand Prix Diving Game sponsored by the International Federation of Swimming.

articles.title: New Kinds of Model Gliders, Intelligent Toys Developed
articles.content:
New Kinds of Model Gliders, Intelligent Toys Developed 
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- More than ten kinds of model gliders and intelligent toys have been developed and produced by the Ansan Toy Manufactory in the DPRK.
					 Kim Chun Guk, director of the manufactory, told KCNA:
					
					 This year we developed transceiver with our own indigenous efforts and technology and locally available raw and other materials, thus opening up a bright prospect for making remote-controlled model gliders and intelligent toys.
					
					 After establishing the serial production process of remote-controlled model gliders and intelligent toys, the manufactory is concentrating its efforts on their production.
					
					 The new model gliders F3M and F3A are being used by players of provincial air clubs as they are available for performing various movements of high technique defined by the International Aeronautical Federation.
					
					 Smart phone-controlled toys like tank are also popular.
					
					 The manufactory also made a manual to make different kinds of planes with wood or paper.
					
					 The model gliders and intelligent toys were highly appreciated at the 15th National Exhibition of Inventions and New Technologies held in July, winning 37 patents.
					
					 The manufactory, founded in April Juche 105 (2016), has a research and manufacturing group consisting of technicians in their twenties and thirties.

articles.title: Green Musk, New Kind of Koryo Medicine, Developed
articles.content:
Green Musk, New Kind of Koryo Medicine, Developed
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The Phyongchon Koryo Medicine Pharmaceutical Factory in the DPRK is producing a new kind of Koryo medicine. It is called green musk because it is similar to musk in its pharmacological action.
					 Mun Sun Ok, manager of the factory, told KCNA:
					
					 Musk has pharmacological actions like heart stimulation, anti-inflammation and stimulation to central nervous system.
					
					 From ancient times the Korean people have used musk for making mind fresh, having blood flow well and removing poison.
					
					 In recent years, the factory developed a new kind of musk and its main ingredients are gingko leaf extract and oil from peppermint, calamus and Abies nephrolepis.
					
					 The newly-developed green musk has a chemical structure similar to muscone, the main ingredient of musk and aromatic matter.
					
					 The home-made green musk is effective for the treatment and prevention of cerebral thrombosis, cerebral concussion and its aftereffect, myocardosis, failure of memory, sleep disturbance and headache caused by gas poisoning.

articles.title: U.S. "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK under Fire
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Department of State recently submitted a "report on human rights abuses in north Korea and inspection of them" to the Congress. And the Department of Treasury issued the third "sanctions step for tackling the human rights performance in north Korea," which added three institutions and seven individuals of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to the "special sanctions target list" on suspicion of "their involvement in human rights abuses." Against this backdrop, the U.S. Congress orchestrated an anti-DPRK farce by letting a bete noire make "testimony" about "human rights abuses" in the DPRK at a hearing of the House of Representatives Foreign Relations Committee.
					 The facts show that the U.S. "human rights" racket against the DPRK is getting frantic like the sanctions and pressure and war moves, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a commentary.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The U.S. persistent anti-DPRK "human rights" racket based on false information is a blatant challenge and intolerable insult to the dignified DPRK, the best cradle of genuine life for the popular masses in the world. It is also the last-ditch effort to check our advance.
					
					 It was the biggest mistake for the Trump group to calculate that their tough sanctions and nuclear threats would make the DPRK step back.
					
					 The U.S. should not impudently style itself as a "human rights judge" but mind its own poor human rights records in its land where racial discrimination, gun-related crimes and all other social crimes prevail.

articles.title: NATO Secretary-General's Remarks under Fire
articles.content:
NATO Secretary-General's Remarks under Fire
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Stoltenberg, secretary-general of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), had an interview with the Yomiuri Shimbun of Japan at the headquarters of the NATO in Brussels some days ago. There he made unreasonable remarks that European countries think that they are within the striking range of DPRK's missiles and that Europe has already been gripped in a crisis. And he claimed that the NATO has either capability for counterattack or resolution and it is necessary to put more pressure on the DPRK.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a commentary:
					
					 His remarks are false and groundless.
					
					 The DPRK's ballistic rockets are for deterring the U.S. nuclear war hysterics and ensuring peace and security on the Korean peninsula and the region. They are not for threatening Europe and the world.
					
					 It is not the DPRK alone that has ICBM in the earth. If what Stoltenberg said is true, the countries with ICBM should naturally be a threat to Europe as it is within their range.
					
					 Stoltenberg will have no word in this regard.
					
					 He was once the prime minister of an European country. Then, how did he make such nonsensical assertion?
					
					 Evidently, he speaks for the impure intention of the U.S.
					
					 He acts like a mouthpiece of the U.S. He revealed his meanness and baseness by turning black into white. Perhaps he is trying to curry favor with the U.S. to prolong his remaining days but he is mistaken. From a historical point of view liars do not last long.

articles.title: S. Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" Should Be Dismantled: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" Should Be Dismantled: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday carries an article on the lapse of 39 years since the emergence of the south Korea-U.S. "combined forces command", a source of disaster suffered by the nation.
					 Noting that the U.S. cooked up the "combined forces command" with the puppets on November 7, 1978 to legitimate its permanent military presence in south Korea and realize its ambition for invading the DPRK, the article says:
					
					 At that time the puppet ruling quarters zealously joined in cooking up the "command" with the U.S. What they sought in this was to leave south Korea as a U.S. military base forever and actively follow their master's war policy against the DPRK so as to keep their stay in power and stifle fellow countrymen by force of arms.
					
					 With the emergence of the ill-famed "combined forces command", the U.S. imperialist aggressors have run amuck in the moves to ignite a war against the DPRK while lording it over south Korea and the people could not but suffer great misfortune and pains with their dignity and sovereignty mercilessly trampled underfoot.
					
					 The "command" is a source that brings war disaster to not only the south Korean people but also the Korean nation as it is a criminal war mechanism for further escalating the war moves against the DPRK allegedly to counter "provocation and threat from the north".
					
					 The south Korean people should strive to retake their usurped dignity and sovereignty and open up the road of peace and reunification by dismantling the "combined forces command", root cause of aggression and war, and driving out the U.S. imperialist aggressors.

articles.title: Minju Joson Calls for Ousting Lunatic Trump
articles.content:
Minju Joson Calls for Ousting Lunatic Trump
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Of late, at least 60 members of the House of Representatives from the Democratic Party and the Republican Party of the U.S. submitted to the Congress a bill preventing Trump  from making a preemptive attack on the DPRK without parliamentary approval. And senators, too, called for introducing such a bill.
					 Former U.S. presidents repeatedly expressed their viewpoints that Trump's right to mount a preemptive strike should be limited as no one can predict when he will start a nuclear war, breaking the precedence in which they refrained from criticism of the sitting president.
					
					 Against this backdrop, U.S. leading media have contended that a law should be enacted to prevent the president from making nuclear attack without approval of Congress. And "Defense of Democracy", a social organization, sued the Trump administration for trying to unilaterally start a war against the DPRK without such approval.
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday says in a commentary such movement in the U.S. shows that Americans are realizing that their country's security is endangered due to Trump's hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The world is undergoing unprecedented throes because of Trump, a notorious "political heretic".
					
					 It is entirely the U.S. responsibility to control such serious situation. The U.S. must oust the lunatic old man from power and withdraw the hostile policy towards the DPRK at once in order to get rid of the abyss of doom.
					
					 The U.S. had better make a decisive choice pondering over the advice of the DPRK if it does not want a horrible nuclear disaster and tragic doom.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams U.S. and S. Korean Puppets for Discussing Preemptive Strike at DPRK
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams U.S. and S. Korean Puppets for Discussing Preemptive Strike at DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, U.S. Secretary of Defense Mattis and south Korean puppet Defense Minister Song Yong Mu had the 49th annual security consultative meeting in Seoul at which they revealed their intention to boost the military cooperation and nexus against the DPRK. Earlier, the chairmen of the U.S. and south Korea joint chiefs of staff discussed "proposals for coping with the north's nuclear and missile threat" at the 42nd south Korea-U.S. Military Committee.
					 Commenting on the fact, Minju Joson Wednesday says that the above-said moves are a dangerous war confab aimed to put the adventurous military option for preemptive strike at the DPRK into practice.
					
					 It clearly suggests that the scenario of the U.S. and puppet warmongers has reached an extremely dangerous phase in their war hysteria to stifle the DPRK with mobilization of every military means and method including nuclear weapons under the pretext of "nuclear and missile threat from the north".
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that the recent war huddles took place at a time when the situation on the Korean Peninsula is driven into the worst crisis owing to the daily-increasing nuclear strategic assets on the peninsula and in its vicinity, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The arch criminal escalating the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula is the U.S. and puppet warmongers blindly following it.
					
					 They should be awakened from their day dream. If they continue to cling to their dangerous military cooperation and nexus, it will only precipitate their catastrophic ruin.

articles.title: Joint Sea Blockade Drills of U.S., S. Korea and Australia
articles.content:
Joint Sea Blockade Drills of U.S., S. Korea and Australia
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist warmongers conducted joint sea blockade drills in the waters off Jeju Island of south Korea on Nov. 6 and 7, together with south Korean armed forces and Australian naval forces, according to Yonhap News.
					 Hurled into the exercises were Aegis destroyers, escort and other warships of different missions and sea-patrol planes and naval operational copters of the U.S., south Korea and Australia.
					
					 The trigger-happy forces engaged themselves in drills for sea blockade, vessel detection and tracking and inspection against the DPRK in case of emergency.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Censures Trump and Present Chief Executive
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Censures Trump and Present Chief Executive
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The ad-hoc committee for getting THAAD withdrawn and achieving peace on the Korean peninsula of the Taejon Headquarters of Movement for Achieving People's Rights and Removing Evils of south Korea held a press conference on Monday outside the Taejon City Office, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Tongil News.
					 The organization blamed the chief executive for his plan to greet war maniac Trump as a "state guest."
					
					 Noting deployment of THAAD, joint military drills, sanctions and threats of war against the north increased the danger of war on the Korean peninsula, speakers at the conference urged the U.S. to retract the deployment project and the regime to set right all unfair things including the south Korea-U.S. "mutual defense treaty."
					
					 Claiming that they can never overlook Trump's reckless acts to exterminate the Korean nation, they called on the public to turn out in the actions to preserve the vital rights of the nation and achieve peace.

articles.title: S. Korean Political Party Protest against Trump's Visit
articles.content:
S. Korean Political Party Protest against Trump's Visit
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Members of the People's Party of south Korea held a press conference in Kwangju City on Monday in protest against Trump's visit to south Korea and the regime's sycophancy toward the U.S., according to the south Korean online paper Jaju Sibo.
					 Speakers at the conference urged the regime to take an independent stand in order to preserve the people's rights and peace.
					
					 A press release was read out.
					
					 It termed the U.S. muscle-flexing around the Korean peninsula and its vicinity with nuclear carrier task force and other strategic assets, timed to coincide with Trump's south Korean junket, an open threat of war.
					
					 It censured the regime for deploying THAAD and slapping sanctions against the north while talking about stronger "south Korea-U.S. alliance."

articles.title: U.S. Chiefly to Blame for Increasing Danger of War: S. Korean Commentator
articles.content:
U.S. Chiefly to Blame for Increasing Danger of War: S. Korean Commentator
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A commentary holding the U.S. wholly accountable for the crisis and instability on the Korean peninsula
					and urging it to opt for a peace dialogue was posted on the south Korean internet newspaper Chamsesang on Monday.
					
					 Noting the U.S. is chiefly to blame for the deteriorating situation on the Korean peninsula, the commentary said:
					
					 The regime should neither follow Trump's hard-line policy like "independent sanctions" and "preventive attack" nor yield to his pressure any more.
					
					 What is clear is that all military acts and sanctions should be terminated as they only increase tensions now that the U.S. more openly pursues its imperialist policy to undermine peace in Northeast Asia.
					
					 Now is just the time to come out for overall dialogue for concluding a peace treaty and building a peace mechanism, not military confrontation over the nuclear issue.

articles.title: S. Koreans Launch Fierce Anti-Trump, Anti-U.S. Struggles
articles.content:
S. Koreans Launch Fierce Anti-Trump, Anti-U.S. Struggle
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- South Korean people kicked off emergency protests against Trump's visit to south Korea on Nov. 7, according to press reports.
					 In response to the calls of the No-Trump Joint Action, a social organization consisting of at least 220 political parties and social organizations, south Koreans from all walks of life are holding demonstrations, news conferences, candlelight meetings and other diverse protests along the course of Trump visit.
					
					 The anti-Trump, anti-U.S. struggle headquarters and the Kyonggi provincial preparatory committee for anti-Trump, anti-U.S. actions held a news conference outside the Osan U.S. air force base.
					
					 The organizations branded Trump's junket as a war trip.
					
					 Such protests were also staged by university students, religionists and other people of different circles.
					
					 Meanwhile, large anti-U.S., anti-Trump posters were displayed at universities across south Korea all at once.
					
					 South Korean media reported that such struggle would continue until Nov. 8.

articles.title: S. Korean, U.S. Marines Stage Joint Military Exercises
articles.content:
S. Korean, U.S. Marines Stage Joint Military Exercises
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean and U.S. marines launched joint exercises in Paekryong and Yonphyong islands on Oct. 30, with the war maniac Trump's visit to south Korea as an occasion, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 Involved in the rehearsal are the 1st division and the 6th brigade of the south Korean puppet Marine Corps and troops stationed in Yonphyong Island and the 3rd marine task force of the U.S. imperialist aggression army based in Okinawa of Japan.

articles.title: Koreans in Europe Denounces Trump
articles.content:
Koreans in Europe Denounces Trump
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The European Regional Headquarters under the Overseas Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification on Nov. 4 made public a statement to denounce warmonger Trump.
					 The statement said that the world community is stunned at the reckless remarks of Trump about "total destruction" of the DPRK at the UN.
					
					 Noting that the U.S. Congress suggests the amendment of the law on the "president's right to use of force" to prevent breakout of the third world war by Trump's autism, arrogance and self-righteousness, it said:
					
					 In the name of all Koreans desirous of independent and peaceful reunification of the country and the peace-loving mankind around the world, we bitterly denounce warmonger Trump, the Abe regime dreaming of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" obsessed with militarism and the sycophantic traitorous forces depending on outsiders and fully support the No-war, No-Trump demonstrations being held in south Korea and different parts of the world.

articles.title: Paper of Koreans in U.S. Slams S. Korean Regime's Sycophancy
articles.content:
Paper of Koreans in U.S. Slams S. Korean Regime's Sycophancy
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime's sycophantic treachery was denounced by the internet newspaper of Koreans in the U.S., Minjok Tongsin, on Tuesday.
					 The words and deeds of south Korean lawmakers concerning Trump's visit are full of flunkeyism toward the U.S., an article of the paper said, and went on:
					
					 The south Korean conservative forces calling for "south Korea-U.S. alliance" are sycophantic and treacherous camp wanting south Korea to be the slave of the U.S.
					
					 One should clearly understand that Trump's visit to Asia is designed to perpetuate the division of the Korean peninsula and hold hegemony in Asia.
					
					 Candlelight revolution has not yet ended. This sparkle will continue until independence, democracy and peaceful reunification are achieved.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Ethiopia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- An Ethiopian national committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Addis Ababa on Nov. 3.
					 Nigatu Dagnachew, chairman of the Ethiopian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and chairman of the Ethiopia-Korea Committee of Friendship and Solidarity, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 6th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Switzerland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A Swiss committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il on the 6th anniversary of his demise was formed in Basel on Nov. 3.
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee set a remembrance period from Nov. 12 to Dec. 17 and decided to give wide publicity to works of Kim Jong Il and his career and organize political and cultural events including meeting, seminar and film show.

articles.title: Swiss Body Praises Kim Jong Il as Prominent Statesman
articles.content:
Swiss Body Praises Kim Jong Il as Prominent Statesman
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Generalissimo Kim Jong Il is an outstanding statesman and rare thinker-theoretician.
					 This was stressed in a statement which was made public at an inaugural ceremony of the Swiss committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il on the 6th anniversary of his demise held in Basel on Nov. 3.
					
					 The DPRK emerged a nuclear weapons state under the guidance of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il, the statement said, adding:
					
					 He formulated the Songun politics as the basic mode of politics under socialism. This is the greatest and distinguished contribution to the development of the socialist ideology and theory in the 21st century.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Life Praised by Nigerian Body
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Life Praised by Nigerian Body
 Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted articles on its website on Oct. 19 and Nov. 3 to observe the 6th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 An article titled "Mt Paektu and Kim Jong Il" said the august name and exploits of HE Kim Jong Il will shine long along with Mt Paektu, praising his personality as a great man who embodied the spirit of Mt Paektu.
					
					 Another article titled "Kim Jong Il, image of great man" praised the revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il who covered his journey of service to the people without a moment's rest in his ordinary jumper and single padded clothes.
					
					 Noting that he had lived his life as purely as snow, the article said:
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il dedicated his all to the prosperity of the country and happiness of its people.
					
					 He had worked devotedly day and night to add glory to the DPRK as a socialist state centered on the popular masses, protect the destiny of the country and the nation from the heinous moves of the imperialist allied forces and dynamically advance the socialist construction.
					
					 He was born in Mt Paektu in snowy February and weathered storm and stress. The people of the DPRK paid their last respects to him in snowy December.
					
					 The philosophy on snow that runs through the noble life of the great saint is deeply moving the international community.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al rey de Camboya
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al rey de Camboya
Pyongyang, 8 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 8 un mensaje de felicitacion al rey de Camboya, Norodom Sihamoni, con motivo del 64o aniversario de la independencia de ese reino.
					En la misiva, el remitente senalo que el pueblo coreano se alegra de que el pueblo camboyano logre grandes exitos en los trabajos para defender la soberania del pais y lograr la prosperidad bajo la direccion del destinatario.
					
					Formulando votos por la salud y felicidad del monarca, expreso la conviccion de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Camboya seguiran desarrollandose en sentido favorable.

articles.title: Kim Su Gil se reune con delegaciones partidistas de varios paises
articles.content:
Kim Su Gil se reune con delegaciones partidistas de varios paises
Pyongyang, 8 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Kim Su Gil, miembro suplente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, quien participa en calidad del jefe de la delegacion del PTC en el XIX Encuentro Internacional de Partidos Comunistas y Obreros y los actos festivos por el centenario de la Gran Revolucion Socialista de Octubre departio por separado con las delegaciones del Partido Comunista Sudafricano, el Partido Comunista (Marxista) de la India  y el Partido Socialista del Resurgimiento Arabe de Siria.
					El jefe de la delegacion del Partido Comunista Sudafricano, Blade Nzimande, secretario general del CC de este partido, dijo que su organizacion aprecia mucho las relaciones de amistad con el PTC y expreso la conviccion firme de su partido para desarrollar mas las relaciones entre los dos partidos.
					
					Sitaram Yechury, jefe de la delegacion y secretario general del CC, del Partido Comunista (Marxista) de la India, subrayo que se quedo muy conmovido al presenciar con mis ojos los exitos innovadores logrados por el PTC y el pueblo coreano en la construccion de la potencia socialista.
					
					Hilal Hilal, jefe de la delegacion y subsecretario regional del partido sirio, afirmo que las relaciones amistosas entre Siria y Corea, que se prepararon por los lideres antecesores de ambos paises y se desarrollan cada dia mas bajo la profunda atencion del Presidente Bashar al-Assad y el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, seran invariables aunque se cambien las generaciones y la situacion.
					
					Los jefes de las delegaciones partidistas expresaron el firme apoyo y solidaridad con la lucha del PTC y el pueblo coreano que llevan adelante la construccion de la potencia socialista frustrando rotundamente la extremada amenaza militar y la campana de sancion y aplastamiento de EE.UU.
